[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:550324”]Do you only want a maximum of two people being connected to each other at a time?

If so, you could make a list of some sort that would hold the connected clients, and each connected client would have a “paring ID” which would be the ID of the person they’re chatting with. Set it to like -1 on default.

Then when a new client connects in, check for any other clients that have the paring id of -1, and if so, connect them.

item.title: Java, one on one chat!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Do you only want a maximum of two people being connected to each other at a time?

If so, you could make a list of some sort that would hold the connected clients, and each connected client would have a “paring ID” which would be the ID of the person they’re chatting with. Set it to like -1 on default.

Then when a new client connects in, check for any other clients that have the paring id of -1, and if so, connect them.
If there is no one else available, send them into their own “lobby” to wait for a second person.

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I’d think the benefit of having a server would be able to connect people easier.

Because both clients would connect to the server, and then the server would connect the two.

If you did it without the server, they basically have to find each other on the internet.

I personally would go for the server, at least at first, and then maybe later move on to a server-less application.
